docs.abstract: The Army major has admitted shooting an Afghan man believed to be a bomb maker in 2010, in a case that has become a cause among some conservatives.
docs.snippet: The Army major has admitted shooting an Afghan man believed to be a bomb maker in 2010, in a case that has become a cause among some conservatives.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The long and winding case of Maj. Mathew L. Golsteyn had all the elements of a story that would seize President Trump’s attention. A Green Beret charged by the Army in the killing of a man linked to the Taliban. Thorny questions about America’s longstanding entanglement in Afghanistan. And a Fox News program that lauded the officer as a war hero.

headline.main: Twist in Green Beret’s Extraordinary Story: Trump’s Intervention After Murder Charges
headline.print_headline: Trump’s Input Muddies Case Of  Green Beret

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United States Army Special Forces (Green Berets)

byline.original: By Helene Cooper, Michael Tackett and Taimoor Shah

docs.abstract: Experts agreed that the president could order the government to drop charges against the Chinese telecom executive Meng Wanzhou, but, one said, “it takes the term ‘transactional’ to a new level.”
docs.snippet: Experts agreed that the president could order the government to drop charges against the Chinese telecom executive Meng Wanzhou, but, one said, “it takes the term ‘transactional’ to a new level.”
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When President Trump said in an interview this week that he was willing to intercede in the case of a Chinese telecom executive facing extradition to the United States if it helped achieve “the largest trade deal ever made,” it was a clear signal that his White House saw no problem intervening in the justice system to achieve what it considered economic gain.

headline.main: Trump’s Intervention in Huawei Case Would Be Legal, but Bad Precedent, Experts Say
headline.print_headline: Trump Hints He’d Subordinate Law to ‘Largest Trade Deal’

byline.original: By Michael Tackett and Charlie Savage

docs.abstract: The substance, including calls for unity and a focus on immigration, might sound familiar. But after Democratic gains in the midterm elections, the political backdrop to the speech will be very different from last year’s.
docs.snippet: The substance, including calls for unity and a focus on immigration, might sound familiar. But after Democratic gains in the midterm elections, the political backdrop to the speech will be very different from last year’s.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Trump will deliver his second State of the Union address at 9 p.m. Eastern Time Tuesday night. The speech was originally scheduled for last month, but was postponed because of the partial government shutdown, prompted by Mr. Trump’s demand that Congress pay for a wall along the southern border with Mexico.

headline.main: What to Watch For in the State of the Union Address
headline.print_headline: What to Watch For In the State of the Union

docs.abstract: The president’s eldest daughter hailed the plan as nonpartisan and a “generous” approach to women’s empowerment on behalf of the Trump administration.
docs.snippet: The president’s eldest daughter hailed the plan as nonpartisan and a “generous” approach to women’s empowerment on behalf of the Trump administration.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump is planning to introduce an initiative on Thursday that will seek to help bring economic security to 50 million women across the world by 2025, a program that his eldest daughter, Ivanka Trump, has hailed as a nonpartisan and “generous” approach to women’s empowerment.

headline.main: White House to Unveil a Global Women’s Empowerment Initiative, Led by Ivanka Trump

byline.original: By Katie Rogers and Maggie Haberman

docs.abstract: In the Oval Office, the likely new House speaker takes on a president who is rarely challenged to his face in public, especially by a woman.
docs.snippet: In the Oval Office, the likely new House speaker takes on a president who is rarely challenged to his face in public, especially by a woman.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — It was Round 1: Nancy Pelosi vs. President Trump.

headline.main: Pelosi vs. Trump: ‘Don’t Characterize the Strength That I Bring,’ She Says
headline.print_headline: Pelosi Tells Trump: ‘Don’t Characterize the Strength That I Bring’

byline.original: By Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Annie Karni

docs.abstract: President Trump said he did not want to extend the impasse over funding for a border wall, but it was not clear what he saw as an alternative.
docs.snippet: President Trump said he did not want to extend the impasse over funding for a border wall, but it was not clear what he saw as an alternative.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump said on Monday that he has rejected a proposal by Senator Lindsey Graham of South Carolina to temporarily reopen the government in an effort to jump-start talks with Democratic lawmakers on funding a border wall.

headline.main: Trump Rejects 3-Week Pause in Government Shutdown

byline.original: By Annie Karni and Maggie Haberman

docs.abstract: As he searches for a way to end the political stalemate with Democratic lawmakers, the president finds himself boxed in — a familiar position when it comes to immigration issues
docs.snippet: As he searches for a way to end the political stalemate with Democratic lawmakers, the president finds himself boxed in — a familiar position when it comes to immigration issues
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump has stepped back from declaring a national emergency to pay for a border wall, under pressure from congressional Republicans, his own lawyers and advisers, who say using it as a way out of the government shutdown does not justify the precedent it would set and the legal questions it could raise.

headline.main: Trump Pulls Back From Declaring a National Emergency to Fund a Wall
headline.print_headline: Trump Retreats From Declaring National Emergency Over Wall

byline.original: By Annie Karni and Maggie Haberman

docs.abstract: President Trump cast the proposal, which included $5.7 billion for a border barrier, as a compromise as he sought to shift pressure to Democrats to end the government shutdown.
docs.snippet: President Trump cast the proposal, which included $5.7 billion for a border barrier, as a compromise as he sought to shift pressure to Democrats to end the government shutdown.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump, facing a growing public backlash over the partial government shutdown, shifted course on Saturday and offered Democrats a deal: temporary protections for roughly 700,000 young undocumented immigrants in exchange for $5.7 billion in funding for a wall along the southern border.

headline.main: Trump Offers Temporary Protections for ‘Dreamers’ in Exchange for Wall Funding
headline.print_headline: President Offers Deal on ‘Dreamers’ to Secure a Wall

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dream Act (Development, Relief and Education for Minors Act)

byline.original: By Annie Karni and Sheryl Gay Stolberg

docs.abstract: Finding a replacement for the White House chief of staff, John F. Kelly, is in many ways just the latest staffing snare in a White House that has struggled to fill even low-ranking jobs.
docs.snippet: Finding a replacement for the White House chief of staff, John F. Kelly, is in many ways just the latest staffing snare in a White House that has struggled to fill even low-ranking jobs.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump has often bragged about having his pick of only the best people to serve in his administration.

headline.main: After Ayers Turns Down Chief of Staff Job, Trump Is Left Without a Plan B
headline.print_headline: New Gatekeeper for Trump? They’re Not Breaking Down the Door

byline.original: By Katie Rogers, Maggie Haberman and Annie Karni

docs.abstract: The departure of John F. Kelly leaves the president with an ever-shrinking team of close advisers as he begins to navigate the new power structure on Capitol Hill.
docs.snippet: The departure of John F. Kelly leaves the president with an ever-shrinking team of close advisers as he begins to navigate the new power structure on Capitol Hill.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump said on Saturday that his chief of staff, John F. Kelly, would step down by the end of the year, the latest move in a long-planned staff shake-up as the president heads into the 2020 campaign facing growing peril from the special counsel and newly empowered Democrats.

headline.main: John Kelly to Step Down as Trump, Facing New Perils, Shakes Up Staff
headline.print_headline: Kelly Out as Chief of Staff by Year’s End; Pence Aide Is Top Candidate

byline.original: By Annie Karni and Maggie Haberman
